definition: road condition(s) (e.g. surface, traffic flow etc)

sentences.english: Many car radios are fitted with RDS (radio data systems) which carry local radio reports.
sentences.chinese: 許多車載廣播臺都配有報告最新路況的電臺。

sentences.english: Could you tell me what the expressway is like between Canton and Dalhart?
sentences.chinese: 請問康頓到哈德特之間的高速公路路況如何？

sentences.english: Improved perception of better road conditions by local communities.
sentences.chinese: 增強了當地社區居民對改善路況重要性的認識。

sentences.english: Non-existent lighting and poor road conditions make driving at night hazardous.
sentences.chinese: 沒有路燈，路況糟糕，讓夜間駕駛變得非常危險。

sentences.english: Trafficability means the ability of vehicle passing through a variety of road conditions.
sentences.chinese: 通過性是指車輛通過各種路況的能力。

sentences.english: Application of the grey clustering evaluation to inhered road condition.
sentences.chinese: 灰色聚類評估在高速公路原有路況評價中的應用。

sentences.english: Other researchers have used computer vision systems to observe the road.
sentences.chinese: 其他研究人員利用計算機圖像系統觀察路況。

sentences.english: Wait until the way is clear before entering the intersection.
sentences.chinese: 等待路況安全後，再駛入十字路口。

sentences.english: How do you get road news?
sentences.chinese: 你怎麼得到路況信息的呢？

sentences.english: The road conditions are appalling, especially on the Central African side.
sentences.chinese: 路況很糟糕，尤其是在中非那邊。

definition: to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
to ride (a bicycle, horse, motorbike etc)/cycling/horseback riding/motorbike riding/a ride/CL:次[ci4]
to hasten on with one's journey/to hurry on
lit. flower viewing from horseback (idiom); fig. superficial understanding from cursory observation/to make a quick judgment based on inadequate information
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
traffic/to drive (i.e. travel in a vehicle)
to travel along a route (of vehicles etc)
car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
